result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis R Brockman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court does not order a DV surcharge.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample (if not previously done) for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
NO CONTACT WITH ANYONE UNDER 16. NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation.

Defendant Dennis R Brockman in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence.  
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence.  
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Dennis R Brockman in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams. Jesica Ballenger for Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misd.
AS TO COUNT 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misd.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis R Brockman in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's report received and filed.
Dr. Rawski.

NO COURT FILE. Court vacates trial date.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Court appointed Dr. Rawski to be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16 and 971.14(2).

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis R Brockman in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on doctor's report. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Parties are not challenging the findings of the report. Court accepts the opinions of Dr. Rawski and finds the defendant currently not competent but likely to regain competency within the statutory time period. Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency. Court recommends the defendant participate in the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program. Court ordered proceedings be SUSPENDED. Order signed, filed, and emailed to OCRP. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Forensic Unit report written by Dr. Rawski received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Dennis R Brockman in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State. Defense counsel advised the Court there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. State does not object. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Competency Evaluation scheduled for 4/1/2015 at 12:00 pm in the Safety Building, Room 504. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed with court.

Parties are prepared to proceed with the preliminary hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25. Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dennis R Brockman in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Joshua Miles Mathy on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case recalled. Indigency hearing continued. Court appointed attorney Daniel Morgan Adams, now present in court. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.

Defendant Dennis R Brockman in court.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for indigency hearing. Defendant's Petition for Appointment of Counsel received and filed. ADA Mathy now appears on behalf of the State.   Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed counsel to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $60.00 per month starting 03/01/2015 and then on the 1st of each month there after. Case passed to allow attorney Adams to appear in court.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EB; CB; and KB.

Defendant Dennis R Brockman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Defense requesting an Indigency Hearing on behalf of the Defendant. Court will toll time limits.  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 02-13-2015 at 01:30pm
